items.abstract: <jats:p>The hydrogenation under atmospheric pressure of waste polymer pyrolysis fractions over 5% Pt/<jats:italic>γ</jats:italic>-Al<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>O<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>with hydrogen from the catalytic decomposition of methanol over 5% CoO/SiO<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>has been performed. A 97–100% C=C bond hydrogenation selectivity was achieved at 300°C. The obtained saturated C<jats:sub>6</jats:sub>–C<jats:sub>20</jats:sub>and C<jats:sub>20</jats:sub>–C<jats:sub>30</jats:sub>fractions can be applied as blending material for fuels and lubricants, respectively, or as hydrocarbon feed. The applied coupled catalytic system exhibited high efficiency at 300°C for at least 5 hours.</jats:p>
title: Reduction of Polymer Waste Pyrolysis Fractions over Pt/Al2O3with Methanol Decomposition Hydrogen to Obtain Fuel-Grade Hydrocarbons

items.abstract:
<jats:title>Modified halloysite as a filler for epoxy resins</jats:title>
        <jats:p>The modification methods of halloysite and further applications of the modified mineral as a filler for epoxy resins have been presented. The advantage of ultrasound treatment prior to chemical modification with an organic compound in order to obtain a hybrid filler was confirmed. The analysis of the composites obtained with the use of the modified halloysite (3-5 wt.% range) as a filler for epoxy resins indicates an improved interphase interaction and mechanical properties in comparison to the composites based on neat halloysite.</jats:p>
title: Modified halloysite as a filler for epoxy resins
